Selector module¶

class Selector.Selector(sel_params)[source]¶

Bases: object

Selects parents to be used for crossover and mutation.

When creating a new Selector() obejct, must be initialized with dictionary sel_params (containing selection method). Object can then be used as a function that selects parents according to the specified method.

sel_params(dict of str

): Dictionary of parameters required by selector objects.

sel_params['method']

Name of chosen selection methodself.

Type:str
sel_params['tourn_size']

Number of indices in each tournament. Only needed for tournament method.

Type:int
sel_params['tourn_prob']

Probability of selecting first index in each tournament. Only needed for tournament method.

Type:int
inverse_square_rank_probability(num_parents, population)[source]¶

Selects parents according to inverse square rank method.

Creates a cdf, with each entry the cumulative sum of 1/sqrt(N) for N = 1, … Random values are then produced between the largest and smallest elements of the list. Each parent is chosen as the index in the cdf that the corresponding random value falls. In this way, the most probable parents are those with the highest fitness scores.

Parameters:
  • num_parents (int) – The number of parents to select.
  • population (list) – List of Truss objects that constitutes the current generation.
Returns:

Numpy array of indices in population

corresponding to selected parents.
Return type:

parents (ndarray)
tournament(num_parents, population)[source]¶

Selects parents according to tournament method.

(ASSUMES POPULATION IS SORTED BY FITNESS) Randomly selects truss indices from population in groups called tournaments according to “tourn_size.” Each tournament is then sorted by index (lower means more fit) in ascending order and a single index from each tournament is selected. The selection from each tournament is chosen probabilistically, assigning the first, most fit, index with probability p = tourn_prob, and then subsequent indices by p*(1-p)^n. The winners of each tournament are then returned as the parents array.

Parameters:
  • num_parents (int) – The number of parents to select.
  • population (list) – List of Truss objects that constitutes the current generation.
Returns:

Numpy array of indices in population

corresponding to selected parents.
Return type:

parents (ndarray)
